feed.subtitle: A simple, whitespace theme for academics. Based on [*folio](https://github.com/bogoli/-folio) design.

entry.title: What I like
entry.content:
Like

  • Cutlery (Yes, spoon)
  • Banana (I think their appearance makes me happy)
  • Woody scent (Do you know that koreans have a deep preference to the woody fregrance bacause of their forests?)
  • Post-traumatic Growth
  • Cute robots
  • People with non-human friends
  • Classic watch
  • Stars
  • Flan
  • K-food (This is a given. I can talk about this for 5 days)
  • Axolotl (The cutest)
  • Movie with a nice plot (I like the pose-traumatic growth. Share me your favorite!)
  • Personality Talk (I studied psychology but I like to talk about MBTI the shit. Sorry. I really like the environment to freely talk about themselves and their personality. I also like the story of getting-to-know of both extremes.)
  • Evolutionary psychology (lowkey)

Dislike coming soon

entry.title: Why I transitioned from psychology to CS

link.title: Why I transitioned from psychology to CS

entry.content:
I love psychology because psychologists come up with the very clever ideas how to measure the unseen human mind (operational definitions).

  • Agressiveness by giving hot sauce (Lieberman, 1999)
  • Conscientiousness by Room cleanness (Gosling, 2002)

However, I found myself wanting a more direct and faster way to test and demonstrate my hypotheses about the social desire and fulfillment of humans. I am truely interested in dealing robot as new social cue stimuli based on strong assumption that human has weak and attackable censoring system to the social sign from other one. I like the numeric tables and plots which can intuitively and reproductively show the contribution of the study.
